chapter.title: Install or Update oXygen
chapter.para: To install or update oXygen Author or Editor, you use a Java web start (JWS) application.
When you run the JWS application for the first time, JWS downloads the entire package, which contains multiple jar files. The download takes a few minutes on a reasonably fast connection.

procedure.title: To download oXygen Author or Editor

step.para: On the web start page, click one of the following links:

listitem.para: Run <oXygen/> Author: Typically used by technical writers to edit Rackbook (DocBook) documents and WADL files.
Run <oXygen/> Editor: Typically used by members of the DocTools team to edit Rackbook (DocBook) documents and WADL files. Also includes XSD and XSLT-related features.

step.para: On the Opening author.jnlp dialog box, accept the default selection, and click OK.
After the oXygen application launches for the first time, you must supply an oXygen Author or Editor license. If you do not have one, request one from a member of the Doc Tools team or your manager.
The download adds an icon to the Dock, which looks like this:
The download adds an application icon to your Applications folder, which looks like this:
To start oXygen after the initial installation, add the application to your Dock from your Applications folder, or use JWS to download and update the oXygen.

When you launch the JWS application again to upgrade oXygen, JWS downloads modified jar files only. If no new jars are found or network connectivity is unavailable, oXygen Author or Editor starts immediately.

note.para: If you install oXygen Author or Editor through JWS and add oXygen plugins to that installation, those plugins are removed when you use JWS to update oXygen.
